alert.note: Alert for Hitchcock; Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 4:43PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Red Willow and southeastern Hitchcock Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 442 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northwest of Herndon, or 11 miles southeast of Trenton, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Red Willow and southeastern Hitchcock Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
